title: Shop
text:
Check out my Etsy shop at thecodingcats.etsy.com
Thank you so much for supporting my brand new small business! It truly means the world to me.
This shop was born from posit::conf(2023), a data science conference with a community of amazing people who happen to love programming & cats. While there are lots of Python, Javascript, and other programming merch out there, there‚Äôs little representation for the R statistical language! I hope to change that, with my own twist of adding cute cats to R themed designs.
All of my designs are available in any product type. If you see a design you like but want it on something else or would like it personalized, please reach out!

title: Spatial Geography
text:
Welcome to Spatial Geography
I am Pulakesh Pradhan, a Research Scholar in the Department of Geography at Ravenshaw University.
My work focuses on Geospatial Intelligence, Google Earth Engine, and Remote Sensing applications for environmental monitoring. I am the creator of the GEE AI Assistant and run the Spatial Geography YouTube channel.
I specialize in: - üõ∞Ô∏è Satellite Image Processing - üåç Disaster Management (Flood/Drought) - üíª Geospatial Tool Development
Feel free to explore my research, projects, and tutorials!

Fundamentals of Google Earth Engine
text:
Welcome to the Fundamentals of Google Earth Engine! This course is designed to guide you through the essential concepts and practical applications of GEE for environmental monitoring and spatial analysis.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Making sure all content I publish on the web is accessible to anyone and everyone is very important to me. While I‚Äôm not an expert on web design or accessibility, I am committed to trying my best.
This accessibility commitment was adapted from Silvia Canel√≥n‚Äôs excellent blog.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Feedback
I welcome any feedback on the accessibility and inclusivity of my site and content. Please let me know if you encounter any accessibility barriers or areas for improvement and I‚Äôll do my best to remedy them.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Accessibility practices
This site has been designed with the following features in mind:

A color palette that meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards for contrast.
Alternative text for all informative images.
Readable font faces, specifically to avoid impostor letter shapes and mirroring.

Each character in [iIl], [ceo], and [db qp] should all be distinct from one another.1
This site primarily uses Domine for headings, Atkinson Hyperlegible for body text (developed by the Braille Institute), and Fira Code for code.

A table of contents in the sidebars for easier navigation.

I use Google‚Äôs Lighthouse accessibility tests to check the accessibility of my website at each deployment. While I would love a perfect score of 100, I commit to a score of at least 80. The Quarto GitHub has quite a few open GitHub issues with accessibility tags that I have no control over.

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Accessibility tools

Google Lighthouse Tool
Google Chrome Accessibility Features Reference
Colour Contrast Checker
Viz Palette
WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool
Microsoft Edge Accessibility Guide

title: Accessibility commitment
text:
Footnotes


Added the [ceo] and [db qp] tests from Cara Thompson‚Äôs amazing data viz design system talk, specifically slide 22: Font inspiration.‚Ü©Ô∏é

title: About Me
text:
I am Pulakesh Pradhan, currently a Research Scholar at the Department of Geography, Ravenshaw University. My research interests lie in the applications of Remote Sensing, GIS, and Machine Learning for environmental problem-solving.
I am an advocate for open-source geospatial tools and knowledge sharing. Through my YouTube channel, Spatial Geography, I aim to make learning Google Earth Engine and other geospatial technologies accessible to everyone.

title: Part 1: The Basics
text: The Earth Engine Code Editor is where you will spend most of your time. It is divided into four main panels: - Editor: Scripting area (Center) - Map: Visualization area (Bottom) - Console: Output area (Right) - Docs/Assets: Reference and Data area (Left)

Part 3: Spatial Operations & Charting
text:
3.2 Using Custom Assets
For your own study areas: 1. Navigate to the Assets tab. 2. Select New > Shapefile. 3. Upload your files (.shp, .shx, .dbf, .prj). 4. Import the asset into your script using its path.

title: Part 3: Spatial Operations & Charting
Projects
text: I develop tools and applications to solve real-world geospatial problems. Here are some of my key projects:

title: Projects
text:
üõ†Ô∏è Google Earth Engine Apps

GEE AI Assistant
Status: Live | Type: Browser Extension An AI-powered assistant for Google Earth Engine to help users write code and analyze data more efficiently. Watch Demo


Flood Susceptibility AHP Tool
Status: Live | Type: Web App A web application to create Flood Susceptibility Maps for any Indian State or District using the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP).


Phenology Signature Tool
Status: Live | Type: Web App A tool for monitoring crop phenology and analyzing spectral signatures over time.


Spectral Reflectance Curve
Status: Live | Type: Web App Generate accurate training samples by visualizing spectral signature curves for different land cover types.
